fields.summary: Android: Push notifications are not being delivered to devices of newly registered users while working for existing users, but showing as successful on the push logs

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description: Push notifications to Android devices (possibly iOS as well) have stopped working since the beginning of this year, nothing changed in our code. We have tried sending via curl and from the web console, the messages show up under the push logs on the web interface and are listed as successful, however they are not coming through on any of the devices.
fields.summary: Android: Push notifications are not being delivered to devices but showing as successful on the push logs

comments.body:
Wayne,

Not sure if you are using MQTT for push. If so, please read the details http://www.appcelerator.com/blog/2013/08/android-push-notification-deprecating-mqtt-in-favor-of-gcm/ about discontinuation of MQTT since the begining of the year.

If this is not an MQTT issue, please post some additional details. You can send us the app GUID, ACS app ID by email at shossain@appcelerator.com and we will have a look into it ASAP.

Thanks,
